value.title: DAX Fridays #155: How to set default value of a slicer in Power BI
value.excerpt: In today's video, I will show you how to set the default value of a slicer in Power Bi using some simple DAX.  Previous video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q4hF4CwJsFE SELECTED value tutorial: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FI1_N-imBxI&vl=en  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: DAX Fridays #201: How to create virtual tables using DAX
value.excerpt: In this video I will show you how you create virtual tables in DAX to do calculations on them.   Happy Friday! value.title: DAX Fridays! #74: PREVIOUSDAY, PREVIOUSMONTH, PREVIOUSQUARTER, PREVIOUSYEAR
value.excerpt: In todayâ€™s video I we will go through how to build a time intelligence measure in DAX using the PREVIOUSDAY, PREVIOUSMONTH, PREVIOUSQUARTER, PREVIOUSYEAR.  We will first go through PREVIOUSYEAR DAX function and explain how can those functions can be combined with CALCULATE to create the correct measure.

value.title: DAX Fridays! #81: CALCULATETABLE
value.excerpt: In todays video we are going to cover the DAX function CALCULATETABLE.  CALCULATETABLE allows you to create virtual tables that you can then filter using multiple conditions and use that table to make further calculations.   What is the difference between CALCULATETABLE and CALCULATE?  The first one

value.title: Showing Ranking in a Visual in Power BI using RANKX DAX function
value.excerpt: If you want to show the ranking in a Power BI visual, one way is to use a visual that supports that, such as a Ribbon chart. value.title: Write Conditional Statement Using SWITCH in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: Conditional expressions are one of the most commonly used expressions in any language as well as DAX. value.title: Computing a measure in DAX Studio

value.title: Using OR conditions between slicers in DAX
value.excerpt: How to implement a logical OR condition between two slicers of a Power BI report, or of a PivotTable in Excel. By default, when relying on more than one slicer they are considered in an AND condition. This video+article explains how to change this behavior using DAX.  Article and sample download: https://sql.bi/66373?aff=yt

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: DAX Fridays! #14: SUMMARIZE
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the function SUMMARIZE in DAX/ Powerpivot.  The function SUMMARIZE can return a summary of sales grouped around the calendar year and the product category name, this result table allows you to do analysis over the reseller sales by year and product category.  Source:https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg492171.aspx

value.title: DAX Fridays! #77: GROUPBY, CURRENTGROUP
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays, we will go through the DAX function GROUPBY with an example.  GROUPBY is similar as SUMMARIZE, but the difference is that in the expression part, you use DAX iterators to get your results. You can also nest GROUPBY functions to get for example the highest sales amount by country.
